description:
Our computational challenges are so big and unique we can't just buy our hardware, we've got to make it ourselves. Our Platforms Team designs and builds the hardware, software and networking technologies that power all of Google's services. As a Mechanical Engineer you design and evaluate our data center systems, identifying product requirements and contributing to research and project planning. From the chip to chiller, you are responsible for designing and optimizing an architecture that will scale with Google's continued growth.

With your technical expertise, you lead and manage projects, develop product and process improvements, provide consultation to others and help facilitate training and development.

Behind everything our users see online is the architecture built by the Technical Infrastructure team to keep it running. From developing and maintaining our data centers to building the next generation of Google platforms, we make Google's product portfolio possible. We're proud to be our engineers' engineers and love voiding warranties by taking things apart so we can rebuild them. We're always on call to keep our networks up and running, ensuring our users have the best and fastest experience possible.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent practical experience.
  • 3 years of experience working with computational fluid dynamics (CFD), thermal analysis techniques, pipe flow (pressure drop) calculations and structural modeling techniques.
  • 3 years of experience working with electronics cooling and FloTHERM.
  • Experience working with cooling strategies used for package, boards, systems and data centers.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience designing technology for data centers.
  • Experience in one or more advanced cooling techniques such as liquid cooling, thermo-electric devices, two-phase heat transfer and/or heat exchangers.
  • Experience with shock and vibration issues related to electronics packaging.
  • Experience capturing acceleration, displacement, sound, temperature, pressure, velocity, power and flow rates.
responsibilities:
• Contribute to the overall system architecture and make interdisciplinary tradeoffs from 'chip to chiller' to optimize the overall computer infrastructure.
  • Develop holistic mechanical designs from package to data center level optimizing for cost and efficiency.
  • Design thermal management hardware including material selection, heat sinks, heat exchangers, air movers, pumps and all supporting equipment.
  • Develop appropriate specifications and test procedures as necessary to ensure desired reliability and performance of electronic equipment.
  • Mentor Engineers in all aspects of concept development, analysis, design and specification.
title: Thermal and Systems Engineer
